column4: hmm it seems my mysql server is also using a PHENOMENAL amount of memory
what numbers are you looking at ?
- the RSS column in ps xal
even the resident set is largely shared - or my machine wouldn't even be able to run the 8 mysqld's @ 28M per thread
hmm.. unless the percentage is ram + swap...
yeah I'm a bit familiar with it, but I'm fighting windmills trying to narrow down what's causing my system to be at a load of over 2 constantly
and you're complaining that you get "only" 4000 FPS ?
yes, the 7600GS should get more than the 6600 which comes in at about 8000FPS
you have seen this personally ?
GS is about 50% worse than the GT - goes for both 6600 and 7600, so if you have a 6600GT and a 7600GS that would be perfectly normal
sudo nvidia-xconfig
(if using edgy, that is)
yes
which one?
I'd start with apt-cache search ajax
I did that.
but since ajax is a combination of technologies and not any specific library or application, I'm not sure what you mean by "ajax API"

well I don't specifically need 'Ajax' per say. Some XhtmlObject stuff packaged would be nice but what I'm really looking to do right now is some dynamic HTML to do nice little things on pictures like wipes and fades for example.
you mean M$ proprietary extensions to HTML ?
huh, no.
something like dynduo, but something that's actually supported.
I have no clue, sorry
loop mount, man mount for details
